message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! I think it's a great opportunity for you to own it, and I'm confident you'll love it. I'm willing to start with a price of $18,000. What do you think?
Thanks for the offer, Alice.  $18,000 is a bit steep for me.  I'm really interested in the product, but I'm only able to go up to $10,000 at this point. Let's see if we can find some common ground.

I understand that $10,000 is a bit lower than I was hoping for, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'm thinking of a price of $14,000. This is a fair price considering the value the product will bring to you. What do you think?

Alice, I appreciate you being willing to compromise, but $14,000 is still a bit out of my budget.  I'm prepared to offer $11,000.  This is a fair price, given that I'm willing to close the deal now. Let's make this happen.

I understand that you're trying to get the best deal, Bob, but I'm not willing to go as low as $11,000. I'm willing to meet you in the middle again, but this time I'll compromise at $13,500. I think this is a fair price considering the value the product will bring to you. What do you think?

Alice, I appreciate you being flexible, but $13,500 is still a bit high for me. I'm willing to go up to $12,500, which is a significant compromise from my previous offer.  Let's close this deal and avoid going back and forth any further.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Bob, but I'm not willing to go as low as $12,500. I'm willing to meet you at $13,000, but I'm not budging any further. This is the best price I can offer, and I think it's a fair price considering the value the product will bring to you. What do you think?
